# WebKitCSSKeyframesRule

`WebKitCSSKeyframesRule` objects represent the keyframes for a single animation, that is, the contents of an  @-webkit-keyframes CSS rule used in animations. The [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/webkitjs/webkitanimationevent] class encapsulate information about running animations.

## Accessing Properties

- **name**: The name of the target animation that is set using the -webkit-animation-name property.
- **cssRules**: The set of style rules that define the keyframes following the animation name.

## Changing Rules

- **insertRule**: Adds a keyframe rule to the collection of keyframes.
- **deleteRule**: Removes a keyframe rule from the collection of keyframes.
- **findRule**: Returns the keyframe rule for the specified selector.
